intro: Neumannia integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf neumannia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, elongated leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Neumannia integrifolia is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
